alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 16 at 10:12AM MDT until August 16 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following areas, Far Northeast Highlands and Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 10 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Strong, slow moving storms will be capable of producing torrential rainfall late this afternoon and evening. Amounts between 2 and 4 inches are possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
